Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IdebMalta_Europe
Reviews.Content: Very good location and excellent service. Welcomed with a smile, A very clean and modern hotel with all you need. Just make sure you take your own shampoo and conditioner if you do not like to use one type of soap for all!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DewsWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. The hotel is quirky to say the least. The breakfast area is adjacent to reception and consisted of high bar stools and tables and the rear wall has a large graffiti type mural showing scenes from the Berlin Wall. The carpets throughout have a pattern of footsteps which give the appearance of walking in sand, and the bedrooms have a flat screen television which, when first switched on, gives a flame effect fireplace! The rooms are very small, with little storage space for suitcases, and the shower has a full glass door - could be embarrassing for some couples. Having said that, the situatuion is good, right opposite an underground station and within walking distance of many attractions. Although the road outside is very busy, noise did not seem to be a problem, although our room was on the sixth floor. Rooms lower may have been noisier. Breakfast was good and complimentary tea and coffee are available all day - a good bonus. A good hotel overall, but room size tends to let down the otherwise good accommodation. Good value for money and worth considering for a few days in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: HerliS81
Reviews.Content: I've no idea why this hotel was coming up as a 2 star when I searched. The cost was small in comparison to other hotels in a similar area. Situated next door to the U-bahn, you really can access the whole of Berlin from this hotel. Our room was clean, tidy and modern, exactly as the hotel pictures show it. The free breakfast was fine. Bread, meats, cheeses, cereals, etc. Free coffee throughout the day at the hotel. Staff were always helpful and friendly, offering directions to areas of interest and a free map.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VittoM
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, well located, very clean and with a friendly and professional staff. The room is maybe a bit to small if you plan a long term stay, but for a couple of days is perfect. The breakfast is good and the bagels are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Like the room was a little too cold even if I tried to make it more hot with the AC, but considering -20 and more outside, this was the case in every building. otherwise a nice stay, great location for my business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: LouiseJason
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with our two children in January. We had two connecting rooms, free internet and free breakfast. The rooms were modern, colourful and had everything we wanted. While there were no tea and coffee making in the room, free tea and coffee was available downstairs in reception. Reception staff (especially Tore and David) are great. Really friendly and great fun. Breakfast is a buffet style with good choice. The location is great - just near Rosenthlar Plaza - only a few stops from one of the major stations and near a lot of the major attractions in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiros2178
Reviews.Content: Clean and well sited hotel. The room was nice, quiet and clean enough. There is a U-Bahn station in front of the hotel. Hackescher Markt is ten minutes far on foot so restaraunts and bars are near. Good choice for travelers who want to enjoy Berlin sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaH4300
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and have absolutely nothing to complain about. From the great staff to the interconnecting rooms. The hotel was by far the best priced place we have stayed in for what we received. The staff were friendly and efficient and helped us with every question we had. The hotel reception and breakfast area was so fun, fresh and funky!! We loved the art work. The rest of the hotel was the same, from the footprints on the carpet in the hallway to the innovative designs in the rooms. The only thing to mention is if you book make sure you are comfortable about being naked in front of the person you are sharing with as the room has an open bathrom. They only provide soap dispensers in the bathroom, a razor and green crocodile soap for our son but not other toiletries which was fine with us. The included breakfast was by far the best we have had in terms of variety. Usually when breakfast is included in the room price you can't expect much but this one had everything you could want and it was continually replenished and tidied up. One word of advice, if you are staying over the weekend, as we did, get down to breakfast early if you want croissants cause they go quickly and are the only thing that aren't replenished :) The surrounding area is also fantastic with lots of eating options, bars, a laundromat, the train station and a hairdresser all only a few metres away from the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great value, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: champkis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March for 2 nights and was very impressed. The hotel is newly decorated and is only a 2 minute walk from the metro. Breakfast was excellent and was included in the price. The reception staff were very friendly. The location is very good for seeing Berlin too. I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend this December, the rooms are very clean and well per-paired. With a great breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “All Seasons Hotel Berlin Mitte in December 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel met with my expectations with one major exception. I booked 4 rooms in May for family & friends, to stay in December, at a fixed rate as an ACCOR favourite guest card member. When we checked in the hotel would only honour this rate for 2 rooms. Most of the seating in the dining area is uncomfortable, being quite high chairs. The breakfast which was included in our rate, was fine. The area is well served by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “All Seasons Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: thecawths Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and on both occasions we have been very pleased. It is good to find a value for money hotel that doesn't sacrifice service, cleanliness and quality of rooms. The hotel is well placed for exploring Berlin with an "U" Bahn station only a few metres from the front door. The inclusive breakfast is excellent and the all day free tea, coffee and water is welcome after a day of walking around the sights. We will definitely use this hotel again. Well done All Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent for a two star hotel. Rooms big/flat screen tv/continental breakfast well worth the price compared to four and five star hotels which I would usually stay in. I cant recommend this hotel enough

Reviews.Title: “Central Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located in central Berlin, close to tram and U-bahn connections. The breakfast is the only problem, great food but if you come down after about 0830 it is a complete bun-fight, there is nowhere near enough space for the guests that the hotel can accomodate. Service good, rooms spacious and mind bending carpets. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: Loved the youthful trendy atmosphere and friendly staff. Breakfast area design is totally cool for anyone enjoying drawing/sketching. Fast enough wireless to stream music and browse around at the same time. Relatively short walk to Museum Island. Single room had no chairs but the bedside table-like thingies can be used. At least in a single room the bathroom is not see-through. Rooms facing inner yard are a bit dark, could use one extra light someplace for escaping winter darkness. Air-conditioning is a bit noisy if you're used to silence, so switched off for the night. Btw, at least in november the small area behind the window is ideal to cool off your drink or sandwich :). Hotel with a personality. Would book again if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “young n trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: hyleehy
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very near the metro. not easy to spot the place but u can feel the young energy when u pass by. swift check in. the bathroom is an open concept so i will suggest if u're traveling with friends and like your own privacy, avoid this hotel. room is decently spacious. when i went, it was still new so the bed was still comfortable. the only downside is the sharp edges of the bed frame. i think i "bumped" into the sharp edges twice. breakfast was so-so but i didn't have high expectation from the start so i wasn't really disappointed. for backpackers, the food will be more than enough to fill your tummy and let u roam the city for the next few hours. if u open the windows, u can hear street noises clearly. some decent shopping streets are nearby. to sum it up, it definitely provides good value for a good night sleep. the location is good and makes traveling around berlin easy. =)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: Nuadha
Reviews.Content: I'm rather conflicted about the score I'm giving this. The hospitality was excellent, the amenities were good, the hotel was clean, the staff were friendly. If the bedroom was even a bit bigger and the bathroom was private, then this would have gotten full marks from me. The hotel reception area and breakfast room/bar were bright, spacious, modern and still welcoming. The corridors and bedroom were also bright and welcoming. However the bedroom is far from being spacious. I stayed in a twin room, and there was about 30cm (12 in) space around each bed, with a little bit more between the two beds, but not enough room for someone to pass another person. Of course, there is no room for seating, so if you want to stay in your room for a while, you will have to sit or lay on the bed. Staying with another person, both can't really be up and about because there is not enough room. The bathroom area is part of the room - the shower is clearly visible from most of the room, as is the sink (the toilet is separate, but has no sink). In order to avoid being seen showering or washing, if you're travelling with a friend, they need to sit or lay on the bed nearest the shower, facing the other way - that or leave the room! One thing that really irritates me in hotels in general is noise from the corridor - the room door was really heavy which I guess is what led to us never hearing any noise from the corridor at all during our stay. We barely heard any noise from any of the adjacent rooms, so I guess the hotel rooms must be well soundproofed. Breakfast was mainly bagels and bread rolls, with various jams and preserves, along with slices of cooked ham, parma ham, cheese and salami, fruit, including little glasses of prepared fruit salad, and a few different cereals. Fresh coffee was provided, and a couple of machines provided various coffee drinks, hot milk or hot water for tea. There was free internet, but annoyingly it required registration (lots of details asked for but I found out that only your name and e-mail is required), and your registration details weren't saved. This meant that every time that I got disconnected it meant that I had to enter it again, and since I was using wifi on an android phone, it wasn't a nice thing to have to do. Still it was fine when connected, though I wasn't doing anything too intensive. There were two computers, one with a printer, at tables in the reception area and an iPad (for use at the reception desk only) - all free of charge. Until 10pm you can avail yourself of free tea, coffee and water just off to the side of the reception desk, which was a lovely little feature - you can enjoy this in the sofa area or bar/breakfast area to the side, or there are paper cups available so you can take your drink outside or to your room. The hotel is very near the Rosenthaler Platz stop, and there are a few eateries and bakeries in the immediate vicinity. Quickest way from SXF airport is the RE7 direction Dessau or RB14 direction Nauen to Alexanderplatz station, go downstairs to the U-Bahn station, and take the U8 direction Wittenau/Osloer Str. two stops to Rosenthaler Platz, turning left when getting off the U-Bahn, then left and left again. At the top of the steps to street level, turn left, then head right around the corner to the hotel, just after the "Back-Factory" bakery. Overall I would love to have given this hotel a better score but it has to lose a mark because of the lack of space in the room, which became irritating at times, and the complete lack of privacy in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great for travel with children, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: slowlyraoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the en-suite rooms (2 rooms with interconnecting door) (family of 4). Small but comfortable. Nicely decorated rooms, good shower, excellent breakfast and fast wifi included in our rate. The location is fantastic, you walk out of the hotel and litterally into the U8 metro line (Rosenthaler Platz). There's no real restaurant or room service in the hotel, but you'll find something for every taste within 200 meters of the hotel. Only small criticisms: we didn't have a single chair, stool or sofa in either of the two rooms; pillows were feeling a little cheap, and the air in the room tends to be very dry. Could be related to just our room or the weather, we don't know. All in all, great value for money and an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “AllSeasons Brunnenstrasse”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my extended family at AllSeasons Hotel on Brunnenstrasse in Berlin. The hotel was very good. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful and serviceminded. I would recommend this hotel to others and also myself return to this hotel. On the negative side was that it was really warm in the hotel and that the airconditioner was not working properly. Also a negative side was that we booked two rooms in wich one should have had two beds and in the other room there should have been a doublebed but there was two separate beds in both rooms. Besides this the hotel was really good with a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We slept 2 nights on October 2011 in Berlin Mitte allseasons. Room was nice, clean, modern furnished, but very small, bathroom very good. Little noise you can hear inside (from U-Bahn or Strassenbahn). Very "throbbing" neighborhood. Very helpful reception. Garage very safe, daily price for 17 EUR is worth. Internet free of charge. Breakfast was rich and crew continously refill missing food. We can reccommend to all travelers. Price could be little bit preferable.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Hotel in a Unique Location”
Reviews.Author: bijouM Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I've been into All Season hotels before (in Lille) and I was expecting the same. But Actually it was way better than the Lille Hotel. Staff were all so friendly and speaking very good English, the room was so nice and well decorated (although you may find it confusing or not practical) and I personally liked the location. It is just near a U-Bahn Station so you can get whenever you want really fast, and also if you are good for walking you can reach very interesting districts in just 5 minutes. The good thing about All Season hotels is that they give breakfast, wifi connection and free coffee/tea till 10pm. Although the internet connection was so slow in this hotel. whenever I travel and I do not like to be surprised by a bad local hotel I try to reserve a chain hotel and all season is getting one of my favourites. If you are travelling with your children I think it is a good choice too, the breakfast is good enough to give you the energy you need in the morning (and also you can make some sandwiches as take away) and your kids can enjoy the little breakfast they made just for kids.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: spanitts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a large group for a birthday celebration. Fantastic location, Withing easy walking distance to fab bars/restaurants and local transport. Although you didn't have to go far to eat as there is an amazing kebab shop opposite ( i don't normally do kebebs but they are amazing from this place, fresh salad and proper meat!) Rooms are modern and funky, well equiped with all the necessities. Staff are really friendly and helpful, great English which is just as well! Breakfast was well presented, fresh and plentiful. The breakfast room does get busy but always somewhere to sit and staff are efficient and quick at clearing tables. Free tea and coffee all day as well which is a bonus! Best feature is the huge jar of gummy bears they have on the reception counter,yum! Definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again! The best feature

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel near to the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PhillipDarlington
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic family break staying at this hotel for three nights. A brief rundown: Overall appearance: Quite new and very funky - the hotel is best described as anything but boring! There is free coffee and water available plus limitless green Haribos! Staff: Very friendly and spoke fairly good English (which is just as well as my German is awful). They have a luggage room if you get there early or want to explore a bit more after check out. Rooms: We had two connected rooms which were different to say the least (I don't think there are two rooms the same). They were spotless and well maintained. The TV had around 70 channels with mainly German TV but also English, Italian and French. Breakfast: Great buffet breakfast but note that most of the tables are tables and stools and not chairs. Getting there earlier is best as it tends to get busy after about 9am Location: Excellent location... only 20 minutes to walk into the heart of old East Berlin - Alexanderplatz with its C&A, Galeria Kaufhof, TV Tower, Shopping Centre, etc. The hotel is also right outside the Rosenthaler Platz underground stations (Line U8) and there is also a couple of tram stops which will get you to various places including Bahnhof Friedrichstrasse. Nearby: The hotel is on top of a bakery/cafe called Back-Factory which had a huge range of savouries and pastries and amazingly cheap! Savoury croissants were around 90c, pastries from 80c and even drinks were cheap. On Invalidenstrasse is a well stocked Rewe supermarket. We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Big room, clean, massive windows, love restaurants and shops down the road, tube next to hotel, love channel 71 (fireplace), free internet, bathroom big. The only downside was breakfast time, everybody taking breakfast at the same time. The croissants run out and they don't put more, then you have to eat the bagels.

Reviews.Title: “hot hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and seems to be recently fitted out. Air con did not workin our room and was very noisey with window open. Staff could have been more accomodating. Would only give a small paper cup of ice for room. Location is very central and closr to hop on hop off tours

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DavidC856 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had connecting rooms, so chose the larger for the adults (with wheelchair facilities including wet room for shower and toilet) and smaller room for the teenagers, who didn't really want to share the double bed, but slept like logs once they got there. We were expecting the glass-doored shower, but it's not very public due to the way the room is divided up. The multi-channel TV's were mainly in German (well they would be!) but there were a couple of French channels and Some in English. SKy Movies wasn't showing a picture on the english channel, but while waiting for them to fix it, we could watch one TV with the sound down, and get the sound from the other room. Despite being at a busy junction, there was next to no traffic noise (except from the tram brakes) and we were only up on the third floor. Free W-lan (wifi) was a bonus, and the machines down at reception were in use most of the time. Breakfast was included, and was mobbed on Sunday, so we retreated back to our rooms with our food. Weekdays was much more civilised, with a good choice of continental options, and triple expressos for the brave! The hotel is directly above a U-bahn station, and on 2 tram lines,so transport to the rest of the city is easy. There must be two dozen or more restaurants within 10 minutes walk, with food from all round the world, so you will not starve. Criticisms? None.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, super location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2PTY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in September. When we arrived at 9am on a Sunday morning, our room was ready so we checked in very early. That was wonderful after a long day on airplanes an in airports, as we were coming from Central America. The Berlin Marathon was passing right thru Rosenthaler Platz, the intersection at which the hotel sits. What an exciting greeting to this fascinating city. And though our room was just on the 1st floor and looked right onto this 3-way intersection, we barely heard any street noise. All the workers at the desk spoke English, and the all-you-can-eat breakfast was outstanding. The neighbohood is full of cafes, little restaurants, and shops. The U-bahn station of the U2 line (stop Rosenthaler Platz) is right outside the front door. The only thing I can say that might be a point against the hotel is the shower: the door is clear glass and faces into the main part of the hotel room. Overall the hotel was great and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel concept!”
Reviews.Author: grover33Raleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern,clean, colorful, and brightly lit. Not luxury but has everything you need in a small neatly designed space with budget rates for the area.The room also includes free wifi, local calls and breakfast. The location is great with a U Bahn station, trams and busses right outside the door. There areall sorts of restaurants nearby and the both the Hackesche Höfe and Market are a 10 minute walk. Altho the area is always busy the rooms are quiet due to thick pane windows. The breakfast and service were good. The staff was friendly and willing to answer questions. I would have no hesitation staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with brilliant staff and good extras”
Reviews.Author: bellamanning
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week and were delighted by all aspects of it. The position is superb for exploring the city, the breakfast is plentiful and very fresh and also served until 11am (11.30am on Sundays). The free wi-fi in the rooms is a great bonus as is the PC in the lobby which is also free and has a printer, which means you can check in on line for the flight home and print your boarding passes, which is a huge bonus and saved us hours of queuing at Tegel Airport. Beware that the check-in for BA and other airlines is incredibly slow and the lines are horrendous. If you have checked in you can go to bag drop and there was almost no queue for that. Another big bonus was the free tea, coffee and water all day in the lobby. The staff on reception are incredibly helpful, nothing is too much trouble and they always gave us good advice and were very friendly. There are lots of good places to eat nearby, the hotel reception will tell you where to find them. There is also a large supermarket very close by – REWE in Ackerstrasse (turn right out of hotel then first left at traffic lights and it is on the left.) The hotel is very clean and the room was cleaned thoroughly every day. The flat screen TV is great and there is a reasonable selection of stations in English available. The only problem we found was the small size of the room and the lack of storage space. The shower “in the room” worked fine for us as a couple. I would have liked somewhere to write; there is a hospital type tray/table which goes over the bed, but we used that to put a suitcase on! We asked for a quiet room and it was indeed quiet. At the rear of the hotel, it overlooked flats, but it was so quiet we could have the window open during the night, rather than use the air-con. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, as we found it was great value for money and suited our needs. We definitely want to go back and stay there again. We are also intending to use this chain of hotels in other cities, as we found it such good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “all the essentials”
Reviews.Author: BK_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: This a nice, simple base to explore Berlin. Walking distance to Alexanderplatz and heart of the city. Small rooms but everything you might need. Free coffee / tea / water in the afternoon in the lobby / breakfast room. Good breakfast, a bit cramped sometimes. Parking is a nightmare, underground too small, nothing around. Staff is friendly, Internet and German land line calls are free

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel. Absolutely perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: evilempire13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. From check-in to check-out everything was excellent. Denis on reception checked us in, and his English was excellent, telling us about the hotel, breakfast times etc. Hotel is new and still fresh, and ideally located next to a U-Bahn station and tram stop. Breakfast was continental style, but all items were fresh and replenished often. I would happily return here, and my first experience of the All Seaons chain has been an extremely positive one. Only thing, as other reviewers have mentioned, watch your shins on the end of the bed! Despite this being on a busy street, and the hotel being fully booked when we were there, we did not hear any noise at all from outside or inside.

Reviews.Title: “What a great, friendly, slightly funky place”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good to say about this place. Welcome at reception, room, comfort, breakfast, vibe, U-bahn links. Don't think twice, book it. Accor hotels going for a new market position and it works!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean and Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaz8867
Reviews.Content: Great location next to station. Seems to be a new hotel - fun decor in the lobby and throughout the corridors. Rooms very small - I kept bumping into the corner of the bed - and not much room for storage. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not so did have a bit of a problem sleeping. okay for a short trip, I think it would be frustrating if there for more than 3 or 4 days. Shower is in the bedroom so fine if you are a couple - if friends I would check that the shower is private when booking. Breakfast was really good and free coffee / water trhoughout the day. Staff friendly. Overall an excellent good value for money hotel in a central point of town. When I go back to berlin if i have the same budget i will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Always and Forever”
Reviews.Author: Marcfoe
Reviews.Content: Best suited hotel with children. Modern, new and comfortable rooms. Hotel is direct on main street, but windows are so great, they keep the noise outside. We love it! Service is efficient, decor fit to the city and value for price is good. Breakfast buffet is great! We love the oversized Gummi bears. We have stayed in that hotel three or four times and have booked already again for October and November 2011. Look forward too!

Reviews.Title: “The most functional room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: enton81
Reviews.Content: This hotel really impress us from the very beggining. The ''welcome'' was warm by the staff and generally they were very helpful during our whole stay , our room was small but functional and very clean , and the breakfast was what I expected considering the other hotels of Accor group : Very good and simple. e.g. I have read something in a review before we went there about a bar opposite the hotel , that is noisy and someone couldn't sleep etc. We stayed at room 110 exactly opposite this bar and during Thursday 25 of August there was a big party starting around midnight. We had our windows closed and we heard nothing....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Smirkies
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying here. I found the location really convenient. Food and metro within a min away. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A 2 Star Hotel !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny-Lyle
Reviews.Content: Accor hotels officially designate this hotel as 2 Star. Having stayed in numerous Mercure and Novotels in Berlin before, I find this hard to take in. This new hotel is head and shoulders above anything else I have experienced in Berlin ( including Holiday Inns). Okay, the hotel is new and the rooms are not exactly the most spacious but my single on 6th floor was more than ample for my needs and everything has been thought of. Down to the cordless phone and flat screen t.v. Breakfast is most substantial , if a little repetitive and the free coffee and water not to mention the Gummy Bears adds that little bit that makes all the difference. Location couild not be better. U Bahn and Tram on the doorstep with Alexanderplatz 3 minutes away. Plenty of bars, cafes and eating houses surround Leopold Platz and the prices are as cheap as you will find. I absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of taking in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “sometimes a little too hip”
Reviews.Author: mjygi
Reviews.Content: Great location and a surprisingly quiet room. Decent breakfast and staff, but sometimes the place just felt like it was trying to hard to be trendy. A good value, if you don't mind the open showers--the door fogs up quickly in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are from Greece and we booked our stay at All seasons Berlin Mite, seven moths in advans (from December) and had very good price. Two double rooms conected. We are a acouple with two,10 years old, children.The rooms were very clean and the breakfast super. A great advantage was that the hotel was only 10 meters away from the metro station and only two stations away from Alexanderplatz.. I would recommend this hotel to a friend by all means. Ilias & Ersi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All Seasons Berlin Mitte is easy accesible from both airports and all public transport. Nice huge family rooms - making a break with young children so much easier. Good quality bedding and comfortable beds. Nice breakfast, friendly staff! Made the kids feel at home. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....& class”
Reviews.Author: wilburysway
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive, stylish, modern hotel in the best location in Berlin - if you want to be slap bang right in the middle mof the trendy part of town. Great service, neat rooms, tasty and plentiful breakfast (if you get up before noon - Berlin nights are long!) all done in great style. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky”
Reviews.Author: Haz2011
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable hotel & very helpful staff. The location next to cafes & trains were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Get more than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: OneMonthOff
Reviews.Content: Slept here only for one night but got a very good impression during that short stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a modern, comfy hotel with a good location. In Berlin I always tend to spend my time in Prenzlauer Berg, Friedrichshain and Mitte. Specially for exploring those neighborhoods All Seasons is a very good option. The hotel is situated in Mitte, just a couple of U-Bahn stops from Alexanderplatz and also easily reachable by tram or even on foot. I stayed in a small single room. There certainly wasn't too much space and you could easily get a few bruises from bumping into the furniture but the room was very clean and had everything I needed. The not too wide bed earned top points for comfort: fluffy pillows and covers were to die for after a long day. Service in the hotel was very warm and laid back in a right way. The breakfast room right next to the lobby can probably get a bit cramped during the busiest time in the morning but I managed to fit in just fine with my huge newspaper. The breakfast itself was good: bagels and their toppings as well as smoothies were delicious while the instant cappuccino from a push-the-button-machine didn't (not surprisingly) manage to impress. With it's very reasonable rates All Seasons is really good quality for your money and definitely to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its location and positive reviews, and it exceeded all my expectations. The staff on the reception desk were extremely welcoming, and the free internet and local telephone calls were an added bonus. The room was clean and stylish as well as being extremely quiet. The breakfast was excellent with a wide range of options to suit all tastes, and the availability of coffee and tea throughout the day was a really nice touch. It is obvious that every aspect of the hotel has been thoroughly thought out to appeal to all guests, and I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: flyguy70 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, great location, staff couldnt have been more helpful and friendly. Interior design was quirky and interesting, beds comfortable and room lovely and quiet. Buffet breakfast was well managed, well stocked and fresh with a great selection of meats, cheeses, cereals and fruit. Easy to walk into the city or take the subway across the road from the hotel. Room 709 was fantastic and will ask for the room again next time we book; worth paying a bit extra for. Any negatives? Only that the wetroom in the bedroom had no where to hang a towel which given the thought that had gone into the design of the room was a bit of a shame. Also would have been nice to have other English speaking TV channels other than BBC News. But hey, we were there to see the fantastic city of Berlin and not watch TV. Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Juan141171
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located by the Rosenthaler Platz underground station and two stops away from Alexanderplatz, so very central. The rooms are nicely decorated and have separate toilet/shower. When I checked in I was greeted by a somewhat bizarre receptionist who kept on asking for my car registration number, like 4 times, as it wasn't a German car, that was a bit too difficult to understand for him, so was the fact that my dad and I have the same first name, that was too a bit too hard to take in, and after a long drive from Prague I found him slightly irritating - the early shift reception staff on the other hand were very helpful and attitude-free. The car park costs €17 per night and a €50 deposit is required in case you loose the parking card! Breakfast is excellent and plentiful, all in all a good stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Dina
Reviews.Content: the All Seasons is a nice place to stay in Berlin. It is a designer hotel which is very cheap (I got the room for 65 Euro), very clean and it has very cheerful employees. The breakfast didn't wow me but it is by no means bad. I was at breakfast at half seven and heard if you come later it can be so full that you have to take your breakfast standing. When you check-in they give you a little bag with a welcome present. Cute. Wireless throughout the hotel is fast and free. I could sleep with my windows open, despite the hotel being on a very busy crossing. I had a room to the courtyard and heard absolutely nothing!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clear, very good posision, nice rooms. Everything in this hotel was perfect, exsept breakfast. Breakfast was poor and breakfastroom was small for so many people. Some times we waited to find table and we feel bad. But for value money, this problem was realy very small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent affordable all acces to Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent affordable hotel. located near the center. Within minutes you have all the hotspot of berlin sightseeing in your pocket. With the S-Bahn or tram its easy to see everything and allways come home safe. Walking is also a good option. The hotel is clean, practical and with all the stuff you have at home too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recoment this hotel to everyone. It was a new, modern fashion hotel with helpfull staff. The location is good, 10m from U-Bahn 8 and tram M1 and M12. I stayed in family suite with 2 rooms with my family and the rooms were very very good. I suggest it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “ALL SEASON was the best surpise for us in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: nikosnto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It is a totaly new with very good design hotel. The stuff in reception were too friendly and helpful. The breakfast too good and the metro and tram just 10 meters from the door of the hotel. The hotel was very clean, Not noisy at all. There are many good places, cafes and restaurants around the hotel and the neighboorhood is very good. I suggest this hotel to everyone and if i wil be again in Berlin i will stay in the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaniAguilar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice staff, good location with a u-bahn station and a lot of restaurants right next the door. Free wi-fi in the rooms and a good continental breakfast were a bonus. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This review is written in the context of two mature sightseers in Berlin.The ubahn is next to hotel therefore travelling around Berlin on this system is great so location of hotel is not a problem.A number of bars and dining options are just outside the hotel the hotel offers great value for money.a typical continental breakfast is offered and tea and coffee etc is avaible in the foyer.The rooms are not the biggest and lack of wardrobe facilities could be a problem but the room was totally suitable for our needs.Cleanliness and service were first class. Overall for the price paid one would have a difficulty in finding a fault with this hotel for a short stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Richard642
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as my wife was running the Berlin Half Marathon. Very clean and fantastic value for money.Rooms are ideal but as said in previous reviews watch your shins on the bed edges!!. Breakfast very good as the staff are always replenning the food.Desk staff very helpfull. The only downside is the car parking which is under the hotel or on the main road. The price for the under the hotel car parking is 17 euro per day which isn't advertised anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short breaks”
Reviews.Author: klp77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay and was more than happy with this hotel. Rooms were compact but the space was well used. Definitely rooms for couples rather than friends though as the shower door is clear glass! Bed was a little hard and the bed frame is kind of evil when you are moving around - I have the bruises on my knees to prove it ... Most of the staff were really helpful (there was one guy who kind of made you feel like he was doing you a favour when you asked for something). Breakfast was excellent - I've paid a lot more for a lot less in other hotels. The staff kept it fully stocked so it didn't matter what time you went down, and the fact breakfast is served until 11am is great. WiFi is included in the price of your room but the network can be a little temperamental. You also get free tea, coffee and water in Reception all day until 10pm which is a nice touch. We had a room just opposite the lifts but didn't hear anything during the night so the soundproofing is obviously quite good. The hotel confirmation said check in was from 3pm but we arrived at 12pm hoping to leave our bags in the left luggage room, but they let us check in straight away. We left our bags in the left luggage after checking out at no cost, which is great when your flight isn't until late in the day. Hotel is in a pretty good location - very easy to find once you get to Rosenthaler Platz. Its about a 10 minute walk from Alexanderplatz (once you've worked out the quickest route) or 2 stops on U8 on the U-Bahn. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Great ...”
Reviews.Author: indodutch
Reviews.Content: Well, a great new hotel, perfect breakfast, perfect staff with always a friendly smile, very clean and comfortable rooms, free wifi, and right above the u-bahn in the center of mitte what else a man wants? if you go to berlin, great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark187871
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new. The rooms are quite small but they have all the comfort. Comfortable bed and silet place at night. We enjoyed the variety of the breakfast and the general sevices, like tea and coffee free until 22. The staff was very kind and helpful. The location is very good. The U-Bahn station is in front of the hotel and also the M stops. Moreover there are many bars and restaurant in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to u-bahn, geared to younger travellers”
Reviews.Author: brodebec
Reviews.Content: Had only been opened a month so there was still works going on during the day. We were concerned this would create noise in the morning but we didn't have this problem, Rooms are comfortably 'funky' however beware the edges of the bed - both of us had bruises from knocking our legs! Beds were comfortable and room was great quality for the price. Location is great for the u-bahn and easy walk to restaurant strip. Amenities including pharmacy and 24 hour shop in immediate vicinity as well as a number if bars.

Reviews.Title: “The most expressive hotel in the budget class !”
Reviews.Author: robson71andy
Reviews.Content: Most of budget hotels haven't expressive style. This one is different. The lobby is decorated with graffiti similiar to the ' Berliner Mauer'. Rooms are stylish and colorful decorated ,however some could say -dappled and trashy. In my opinion -looks great ! Perfect location- the underground station is directly at the front of hotel, the bakery just around the corner. Traffic is not heard inside- the insulation is perfect . Rooms and bathrooms are very clean so it's typical in Germany. Hot drinks are free at the welcome lounge, tasty breakfast with a wide choice of food. the staff is helpful and friendly. The gave a little gift to my son while we were checking in. I can recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: frosw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at All Seasons Hotel for 6 incredible days. The location was perfect, 30 secs from the metro station, and really close to Alexanderplatz! It was brand new, you could still smell the paint in the hall! Perfectly decorated,playfull, pleasant, amazing!! Also very clean! And cheap... 50 euros per night for a double room! Did I mention the free wireless? The breakfast was more than enough, you could find everything you'd ask for. Also during the day you could have coffee or tea for free and they also provided paper cups so that you can take it out! We enjoyed that every morning :) When I booked it, through a booking website and not straight at the hotel, I requested a room in one of the last floors. I was sure that it wouldn't be fulfilled, because I've done it in the past in other hotels and they didn't provide it, but at All Seasons Hotel, eventhough they were fully booked for the days we stayed there, they gave us a room on the sixth floor!! The only disadvantage was that the rooms were quite small, so it was a problem for our luggages, and that the shower had a see-through glass door and was visible straight from the bed. That is a problem if you are not with your partner. To sum up, if I would go back to Berlin, I'd definitely stay there again. I'd like to emphasize that this wasn't a 2 star hotel. It was more like a 3 or 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: dani_lore
Reviews.Content: wonderful location (the nearest metro station just on the corner; it takes 5/8 minutes walk from the hotel to Alexander platz; moreover PrenztlauerBerg and Mitte are very close ); the rooms are colorful and very comfortable with sink in front of the bed and a large shower. breakfast and wi-fi are included in the price and there's a free pc station for the guests. breakfast is good. the staff is young and polite, but sometimes they have trouble giving suggestions about good restaurants or club. the breakfast lounge is not so large and comfortable especially when there are a lot of guest.

Reviews.Title: “Just opened”
Reviews.Author: JackTrost
Reviews.Content: was in Berlin for a PR function and spent the night at the new all seasons hotel in Berlin. The rooms are very youthful and colorful as is the the rest of the hotel. The lobby gives you the feeling as being part of the city. The breakfast was tasty and filling. Great choice for traveling on a budget.

HotelInfo.Name: All Seasons Hotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Brunnenstrasse 1-2, 10119 Berlin, Germany
